instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5V
threads.message:
draws 00.10 amps

no fluid contact. motherboard is clean

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> :12.29 Volt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5V
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5V
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> : 3.3 volts coming and going. There is voltage for 5 seconds, then there is none. Then it comes again

I guess I need to remove the cage on the <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>. What voltages are required

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5V
threads.message:
T2 requires several AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages to start.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> also fluctuates?
Both USB-C ports have the same behavior?

Check diode mode to ground on all coils.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5V
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> : 1.1 Volt

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>:  12.29 Volt   volts coming and going. There is voltage for 15 seconds, then there is none. Then it comes again 

 Both USB-C ports have the same behavior?  yes

<CHIP>U3200</CHIP> region a little warm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 5V
threads.message: The <CHIP>U8472</CHIP> is punctured I think. <CHIP>U8472</CHIP> pin 1 was showing short with gnd. I removed the <CHIP>U8472</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R8455</RESISTOR>. <RESISTOR>R8455</RESISTOR> pin1 short circuit Is <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> faulty?
